topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5350ce63636872623ad70100#post_5350ce63636872623ad70100
I like Bennet but I will admit he is like a lot of old school otaku. So blinded by nostalgia that they are unwilling to admit anything more recent is good. And I'll say it now, Cowboy Bebob has been surpassed in many ways by recent anime.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5350cf7e636872229af80000#post_5350cf7e636872229af80000
A lot of the stuff he reviews looks perfectly fine to me,

His worst video to be is his Giant robot list, As a Mecha fan, That list infuriates me (The main issues are No getter robo, Attributing the Shine spark to Mazinger Z, And Calling All gundams RX-78s) And you can't blame that on opinion, Because influence on the Genre was what had them make the list along with how much he liked them

I haven't watched any of his videoes in months dude. But Yahtzee, I wanna punch him. He'll take a minor thing (sometimes not even a bad thing) and blow it out of proportion. I remember his Bayonetta review when he said what everyone else says about Bayo _"It's just God of War"_. I've played GoW and it doesn't come anywhere near the perfection of Bayonetta.

topics.body: Has anybody ever considered going out in the wild for a whole month with a gun, a medical kit and a few supplies, and then gathering and making their own food, while scavenging in ghost towns and such? I think that would simulate a zombie apocalypse, but without the zombies.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

Not really, It sounds like it would be interesting to do, But I couldn't be assed

I love super robot anime as is obvious, Especially the stuff that goes as Over the top as possible, Like Getter robo and Shin Mazinger Breaking Z chapter!
